intro: Seddera virgata, commonly known as the slender seddera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptation to harsh conditions, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
